title: Product Set Lower Bound for Small Sumsets
description: If |A+A| ≤ K|A| (small sumset), is |AA| ≥ |A|²/(log|A|)^C for some C? Answer: YES. Solymosi (2009) proved the stronger bound |AA| ≥ c·|A|²/log|A|.

meta.author: Solymosi (2009)
originalContributions: Formal definition of sumset and product set
Solymosi's theorem: |AA| ≥ c·|A|²/log|A| when sumset small

overview.historicalContext: This problem is part of the sum-product phenomenon, a central topic in additive combinatorics. Erdős-Szemerédi conjectured that finite sets cannot have both small sumsets AND small product sets. This problem explores a conditional version: if the sumset IS small, how large must the product set be? Solymosi's 2009 paper 'Bounding multiplicative energy by the sumset' resolved this completely.
overview.problemStatement: Let A be a finite set of integers such that |A+A| ≤ K·|A| for some constant K. Is it true that |A·A| ≥ |A|²/(log|A|)^C for some constant C > 0?
overview.proofStrategy: The formalization defines sumsets, product sets, and the small sumset condition. Solymosi's theorem is stated as the main result, with the proof strategy outlined: bound multiplicative energy from below (Cauchy-Schwarz) and above (Solymosi's lemma), then combine to get the product set bound.
keyInsights: Sets cannot have both strong additive AND multiplicative structure
Small additive doubling forces large multiplicative expansion
The log factor in the denominator is tight (arithmetic progressions show this)
Multiplicative energy is the key intermediate quantity
Solymosi proved C = 1 works, stronger than the original conjecture

conclusion.summary: Erdős Problem #818 asked whether small sumsets force large product sets. Solymosi (2009) proved YES: if |A+A| ≤ K|A|, then |AA| ≥ c·|A|²/log|A|. This is a quantitative form of the sum-product dichotomy.
conclusion.implications: This result shows the power of energy methods in additive combinatorics. By bounding multiplicative energy from both directions, one obtains strong structural information about product sets.
openQuestions: Can the log factor be improved to log^{1-ε}?
What is the optimal constant c in Solymosi's bound?
Do analogous results hold in other groups or rings?
